Command.description:
Defines a single command within the CLI. It specifies the command's execution logic,
parameters, and configuration.

help.description: A description of the command, displayed in the help output.
help.title: Help

params.description:
A list of parameters for the command.
There are three ways to define a param: 
(generic) 1. A string as param definition. Gets appended to the command params signature.
(implicit) 2. A mapping with the param name as the key and the type as the value. Custom types are accepted here. Same as the implicit v1 params syntax. 
(explicit) 3. A mapping with the following keys: `name` (required), `type` (required), `default` (None by default), `help` (Optional), `short` (Optional), `required` (False by default).
params.title: Params

template.description: A reference to a command template defined in the `command_templates` section of the manifest. This allows for reusable command definitions.
template.title: Template

pre_run.description: Script to run before the command's run block. This can be used for setup tasks or preconditions.

post_run.description: Script to run after the command's run block. This can be used for cleanup tasks or post-processing.

aliases.description: A list of aliases for the command. These aliases can be used to invoke the command with a different name.
aliases.title: Aliases

name.description: The name of the command. This is generally derived from the key in the `commands` section of the manifest, but can be explicitly set here.
name.title: Name

config.description: An optional `CommandConfig` object that provides additional configuration options for the command, such as context settings, help text customization, and visibility.

Command.title: Command

CommandConfig.description: Configuration options for a Cliffy command.

context_settings.description:
Arbitrary settings passed to Click's context. Useful for things
        like overriding the default `max_content_width`.
        See Click's documentation for more details:
        https://click.palletsprojects.com/en/8.1.x/advanced/#context-settings
context_settings.title: Context Settings

epilog.description: Text displayed after the help message.
epilog.title: Epilog

short_help.description: Short one-line help message displayed in help overviews.
short_help.title: Short Help

options_metavar.description: Placeholder text displayed for options in help messages.
options_metavar.title: Options Metavar

add_help_option.description: Whether to add the `--help` option automatically.
add_help_option.title: Add Help Option

no_args_is_help.description: If True, invoking the command without any arguments displays the help message.
no_args_is_help.title: No Args Is Help

hidden.description: If True, the command is hidden from help messages and command lists.
hidden.title: Hidden

deprecated.description: If True, the command is marked as deprecated in help messages.
deprecated.title: Deprecated

rich_help_panel.description:
Name of a Rich help panel to display after the default help. This is useful for
        displaying more complex help information, such as tables or formatted text.
        The content of the panel is defined using the `@rich_help` decorator.
rich_help_panel.title: Rich Help Panel

CommandConfig.title: CommandConfig

CommandParam.description:
Defines the structure of a command parameter. It is used
within the `params` field of a `Command` object.

By default, parameters are treated as positional arguments. To specify an option, prefix the name with `--` to indicate flag.

name.description: Parameter name. Prefix with `--` to indicate an option.
name.title: Name

type.description: Parameter type (e.g., 'str', 'int', 'bool', or a custom type defined in the manifest's 'types' section).
type.title: Type

short.description: Short option alias. i.e. '-v' for verbose.
short.title: Short

CommandParam.title: CommandParam

CommandTemplate.description:
Defines a reusable template for command definitions.  Templates allow you to define
common parameters, pre-run/post-run scripts, and configuration options that can be
applied to multiple commands.

params.description: A list of parameters for the command template.  These parameters will be applied to any command that uses this template.
params.title: Params

pre_run.description: Script to run before the command's run and pre-run block. This script will be applied to any command that uses this template.

post_run.description: Script to run after the command's run and post-run block. This script will be applied to any command that uses this template.

config.description: Additional configuration options for commands using this template. This allows customization of help text, context settings, and other Typer command parameters.

CommandTemplate.title: CommandTemplate

GenericCommandParam.title:
Generic Command Param
Gets appended to the command params signature.

RunBlock.description: Command execution logic. Lines prefixed with '$' are treated as shell commands.
RunBlock.title: Command Run Block

RunBlockList.title:
Run Block List
List of Run Blocks executed in order.

SimpleCommandParam.title:
Simple Command Param
Build params with key as the param name and value as the type and default vals, i.e. `verbose: bool = typer.Option(...)`

name.description: The name of the CLI, used when invoking from command line.
name.title: Name

requires.description: List of Python package dependencies for the CLI.Supports requirements specifier syntax.
requires.title: Requires

includes.description: List of external CLI manifests to include.Performs a deep merge of manifests sequentially in the order given to assemble a merged manifest. and finally, deep merges the merged manifest with this manifest.
includes.title: Includes

vars.description: Mapping defining manifest variables that can be referenced in any other blocks. Environments variables can be used in this section with ${some_env_var} for dynamic parsing. Supports jinja2 formatted expressions as values. Interpolate defined vars in other blocks jinja2-styled {{ var_name }}.
vars.title: Vars

imports.description: String block or list of strings containing any module imports. These can be used to import any python modules that the CLI depends on.
imports.title: Imports

functions.description: List of helper function definitions. These functions should be defined as strings that can be executed by the Python interpreter.
functions.title: Functions

types.description: A mapping containing any shared type definitions. These types can be referenced by name in the params section to provide type annotations for args and options defined in the params section.
types.title: Types

commands.description: A mapping containing the command definitions for the CLI. Each command should have a unique key- which can be either a group command or nested subcommands. Nested subcommands are joined by '.' in between each level. Aliases for commands can be separated in the key by '|'. A special '(*)' wildcard can be used to spread the subcommand to all group-level commands
commands.title: Commands
